What is Brief History of Pierce Company?

Currently, Pierce Group is a leading e-commerce operator across Europe, managing popular online stores such as 24MX, XLMOTO, and Sledstore, complemented by approximately forty localized websites catering to various markets. The company holds a dominant position, particularly as the online market leader in the European Offroad segment, capturing an estimated 28% market share, while also competing in the Onroad sector with around 3% market penetration. This current standing is a testament to its strategic evolution and market adaptation since its inception. [...] ## What is the Timeline of Key Events for Pierce?

The Pierce Company history began in 2009 when Pierce Group, initially known as Pierce AB, was founded in Hagersten, Sweden, by Daniel Ted Thomas Petersen. The company's journey saw the launch of XLMOTO in 2017, specifically targeting on-road riders, and the addition of Fredrik Ideström to the team. A significant strategic revision occurred in the latter half of 2023, initiating the 'Pierce 2.0' transformation to foster future growth and profitability. By the second quarter of 2023, the company's white-collar workforce comprised 256 employees. The Pierce Company origins are rooted in a vision for online powersports retail. [...] The establishment of Pierce Company in 2009 marked the beginning of its journey. Founded by Daniel Ted Thomas Petersen, the company's origins are rooted in Sweden. The early years of Pierce Company were characterized by a focused approach to serving the powersports community online. This period laid the groundwork for its future expansion and development. The Pierce Company timeline shows a consistent effort to grow its market reach and product offerings.

# Pierce, Butler and Pierce Manufacturing Company

Pierce, Butler & Pierce Manufacturing Company (1839-193x) was a manufacturer of "heating and sanitary goods" for the bathroom in Syracuse, New York. The company was founded by Sylvester Phineas Pierce and his son, William Kasson Pierce, was president of the firm from 1893 to 1914.

Pierce Manufacturing is a U.S. subsidiary of Oshkosh Corporation, based in Appleton, Wisconsin, that manufactures customized fire and rescue apparatus.

## History

[edit] [...] ## History

[edit]

Pierce was founded in 1913 by Humphrey Pierce and his son Dudley as the Pierce Auto Body Works Inc., which concentrated on building custom truck bodies for the Ford Model T. The first production facility was designed in 1917 and enlarged in 1918 by architect Wallace W. DeLong. From the 1960s to the early 1980s, Pierce was primarily known for building custom bodies on commercial and other manufacturer's custom chassis and was considered an original equipment manufacturer (OEM). In 1996, Pierce was wholly acquired by Oshkosh Corporation.

In September 2021, Pierce acquired an ownership interest in fire engine manufacturer Boise Mobile Equipment (BME) of Boise, Idaho.

## Pierce-Arrow

[edit] [...] Throughout the years, Pierce has had partnerships with various other manufacturers, notably when it came to aerial devices (it now designs and builds all its own aerial devices in-house). Such aerial manufacturers included Snorkel, Pitman, Aerial Innovations (AI), Ladder Towers Incorporated (LTI), Smeal, Bronto Skylift and Nova Quintech (whose assets Pierce/Oshkosh acquired in 1997). In addition to its main facilities in Wisconsin, it also has facilities in Bradenton, Florida. The Florida facility is a manufacturing site for the custom Saber chassis and Responder line of apparatus.
